title: Resistance (Irish Republican poster, ca. 1981)
Text:: Resistance. There can never be peace in Ireland until the foreign, oppressive British presence is removed, leaving all the Irish people as a unit to control their own affairs and determine their own destinies as a sovereign people, free in mind and body, separate and distinct physically, culturally and economically – BOBBY SANDS, 1954-1981.
Additional information:: Shows a gunman against a red background with a Bobby Sands quote.
